bibl.title: Despatch from Henry Rider to William H. Seward, September 16, 1863
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

div1.p:
Consulate of the United States of America at Sierra Leone
16th September 1863.
I have the honor to forward you reports for the quarters ending 31st March, and 30th June respectively.
A want of blank forms prevented taking advantage of an earlier opportunity.

For the quarter ending June 30th American good, to the amount of $75000.00, have been imported in British vessels, which were, formerly, American vessels; the return cargoes of these vessels consisting of African productions amounted to about $70,000.00.
I have to request that a parcel containing the forms required for the verification of Invoices in accordance with the Act of March 3rd 1863 may be supplied to this office.

I have the honor to be
Sir
Your most ob'd't servant
Henry Rider
U.S. Consul Agent
div1.fw:
Hon W. H. Seward
Secretary of State
&c &c &c
